timeline.message:
Allow recording of immutable objects

@RecordableConstructor can now be used to instruct the recoder
to use a given constructor to create immutable objects.

Also document the types that can be recorded.

Fixes #10150

timeline.bodyText: Was this needed for some reason?
timeline.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: Yes, so the way the immutable object recording works is that it maps field names to constructor parameter names. To actually record these names you need to use the -parameters javac option. Otherwise you would need annotations to specify the parameter names.
